prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A student working part-time at the offices of Edgeworth and Co. Studying to be an attorney.
Character 1
Name: Samson Tangaroa
Description: My client, and a man said to be the greatest confectioner of his generation.
Character 2
Name: Artie Frost
Description: The murder victim. Found dead inside Samson Tangaroa's chocolate work.
Character 3
Name: Judy Bound
Description: Assistant to Samson Tangaroa. She's fond of the work of sculptor Paul Halique.
Character 4
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: The detective assigned to this case. A man of few words.
Character 5
Name: Carmelo Gusto
Description: A candy-crafting confectioner who's taking part in the contest.
Character 6
Name: Delicia Scone
Description: A confectioner who will do whatever it takes to achieve her goals.
Character 7
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: The prosecutor in charge of this case. It is said that he has never lost a trial in these past 25 years.
Character 8
Name: Laurice Deauxnim
Description: Pseudonym of Larry Butz, my friend since childhood. He fancies himself as something of an artist.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 10
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 11
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 12
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: The greatest prosecutor ever to prosecute... according to himself, anyway. In actual fact, his relationship with logic is tenuous at best.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. Polishing it every day has become just another part of my daily routine.
Evidence 1
Name: Seal
Description: A seal that was found near the body when it was discovered. What could the design signify?
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes about the crime scene. The police have taken custody of the body. [info] The victim's body found in Samson Tangaroa's room, inside a chocolate treasure chest. The cause of death appears to have been blood loss following blunt force trauma. [caption] The victim's body is curled inside a chest crushed by a ship post. The body is half covered by a blue sheet. There is a silver coin next to the body.
Evidence 3
Name: Mr. Tangaroa's Teapot
Description: A Paul Halique piece with Tangaroa's fingerprints on it.
Evidence 4
Name: Contest Rules
Description: A piece of paper listing the rules for the contest.
Evidence 5
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Someone left finger marks on the chocolate frame, but didn't leave any prints.
Evidence 6
Name: Mansion Key
Description: The one and only key that unlocks every door in the mansion. Tangaroa was in possession of it the entire time.
Evidence 7
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: Salt lamp found in Scone's room. Stained with the victim's blood.
Evidence 8
Name: Fake Confections
Description: Ms. Scone's so-called creations were all fake plastic models, covered in a thick layer of whipped cream.
Evidence 9
Name: Chocolates
Description: Tangaroa's favorite, handmade by Bound. Rather misshapened, and incredibly sweet.
Evidence 10
Name: Instant Camera
Description: Takes photos that develop instantly. A new film cartridge has twenty exposures, but there are only three remaining.
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Frost's Room
Description: A photo of Frost's sculptures, taken by Judy Bound. Two photos, one from Bound and one from Detective Badd.
Evidence 12
Name: Ms. Scone's Statement
Description: Frost's sculptures were "scrumptious", except for the lyre, which was salty.
Evidence 13
Name: Semifinal Entries
Description: Frost's and Gusto's creations had different designs, but tasted the same.
Evidence 14
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 15
Name: Victim's Blood
Description: Frost's blood was found in the fountain, but not at the scene of the crime.
Evidence 16
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 17
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 18
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Documents providing an overview of the IS-7 Incident. Documents received from Fender, including his comments in red.
Evidence 19
Name: Gallery Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet received upon entry to the gallery.
Evidence 20
Name: Winter Wing Photo
Description: Statues matching those made by the victim eighteen years ago.
Evidence 21
Name: Pisces Statue Sketch
Description: A sketch by Larry depicting the Pisces statue exactly as he saw it.
Evidence 22
Name: Used Blowtorch
Description: There are signs it was used just before the police arrived. Possibly to heat something?
Evidence 23
Name: Luminous Cloth
Description: Cloth that glows when connected to a full-spectrum light-emitting device. [caption] Looks like a blue sheet. Delicia Scone's property. One of these was lost eighteen years ago. Given to Bound by Scone. Lost eighteen years ago, only to be rediscovered floating in the fountain.
Evidence 24
Name: Poison Gas Ingredients
Description: The gas was produced when bright red Ubiquium and pure white Asphyxion were mixed together.
Evidence 25
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 26
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Finger marks left by someone in Tangaroa's room. No accompanying prints.
Evidence 27
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: A photograph of the murder weapon from the IS-7 Incident. It's a salt lamp stained with Frost's blood.
Evidence 28
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 29
Name: Teapot
Description: Designed by Paul Halique. One of Judy Bound's prize possessions.
Evidence 30
Name: Ceramic Fragment
Description: Found in a puddle of tea. The design looks familiar.
Evidence 31
Name: Lift Cart
Description: Used by Frost to transport ice eighteen years ago. The top of the platform is wet.
Evidence 32
Name: Larry's Sketches
Description: Sketches depicting exactly what Larry saw.
Evidence 33
Name: Gemini Case Analysis Results
Description: Results of the analysis conducted on the melted contents of the Gemini case.
Evidence 34
Name: Chocolates
Description: Handmade by Bound. Slightly melted after being kept in her pocket.
Evidence 35
Name: Statute of Limitations
Description: A book explaining the statutes of limitations of various crimes.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: If the body had been found in a locked room... Master would've been the prime suspect.
Person: Badd
Testimony 1
Testimony: That's why Master made sure to leave the door to his own room unlocked...
Person: Badd
Testimony 2
Testimony: And to ensure that the body would be seen... Master broke the lid on the treasure chest.
Person: Badd
Testimony 3
Testimony: After the judging... everyone was scheduled to meet in Master's room...
Person: Badd
Testimony 4
Testimony: That would have created the impression... that the murder had occurred... while he was away.
Person: Badd

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the scenario and the provided information.

First, let's look at the characters involved. The victim is Artie Frost, found dead in Samson Tangaroa's chocolate work. Samson is a renowned confectioner and the client of Eddie Fender. Judy Bound is Samson's assistant, and there are several other confectioners involved like Carmelo Gusto and Delicia Scone. The investigators include Tyrell Badd, Dick Gumshoe, and the prosecutor Manfred von Karma.

Now, looking at the evidence list, there are several pieces that stand out. Evidence 2 is the Crime Scene Notes, which describe the victim's body inside a chocolate treasure chest, with blunt force trauma as the cause of death. Evidence 7 is a Salt Lamp found in Scone's room, stained with the victim's blood. This seems significant because it directly links a potential murder weapon to one of the suspects.

Moving on to the testimonies, Testimony 0 through Testimony 4 are from Tyrell Badd. He mentions that if the body was found in a locked room, Samson would be the prime suspect. He explains that Samson left his door unlocked to avoid suspicion and broke the chest lid to make the body visible, creating an alibi by planning a meeting after judging.

Now, looking for contradictions: The Crime Scene Notes (Evidence 2) indicate that the victim died from blunt force trauma inside a locked room. However, Tyrell Badd's testimony suggests that Samson made sure the door was unlocked and the chest lid was broken to make it look like the murder happened while he was away. This implies that the room wasn't locked, contradicting the evidence that the body was found in a locked room.

Therefore, Evidence 2 and Testimony 0 contradict each other because one suggests the room was locked, and the other claims it was left unlocked.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the details provided.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. The victim is Artie Frost, found dead inside Samson Tangaroa's chocolate work. Samson is a renowned confectioner and my client. Other characters include Judy Bound, his assistant; Tyrell Badd, the detective; and several other confectioners and legal figures.

Now, looking at the evidences, there's a lot to unpack. Evidence 2 describes the crime scene, noting that the victim's body was found in a chocolate treasure chest, with blunt force trauma as the cause of death. There's also a blue sheet covering part of the body and a silver coin nearby. Evidence 7 is a salt lamp found in Delicia Scone's room, stained with the victim's blood. This seems significant because it directly links the murder weapon to Delicia.

Moving on to the testimonies, Manfred von Karma testifies that Samson Tangaroa used the rock salt lamp to kill the victim and then placed the murder weapon in Delicia's room to frame her. He also mentions that moving the body was difficult, but moving the weapon was easy, implying that the lack of evidence at the crime scene would point to Delicia.

However, Evidence 2 clearly states that the victim's body was found at the crime scene, specifically in Samson's room, inside the chocolate chest. This directly contradicts von Karma's testimony that Samson moved the body elsewhere or that the body wasn't at the crime scene. The presence of the body in Samson's room suggests that the crime occurred there, and thus, the claim that the body was moved seems inconsistent with the evidence.

Therefore, the contradiction lies between Testimony 0, where von Karma claims Samson used the salt lamp to kill the victim and then moved the weapon to frame Delicia, and Evidence 2, which shows the victim's body was found in Samson's room, indicating the crime happened there and the body wasn't moved as suggested.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the scenario. We have a murder victim, Artie Frost, found inside Samson Tangaroa's chocolate work. The evidence list includes various items found at the crime scene and related to the case, while the testimonies are statements made by different individuals involved.

First, I'll look at the testimonies provided by Debeste. Testimony 0 suggests that the artist was the first to discover the victim, making him the best suspect. Testimony 1 mentions that the poison gas was caused by Normallium, a chemical found in paint. Testimony 2 points out that the artist was carrying paint near the victim, giving him the best chance to commit the crime. Testimony 3 concludes that the paint and being the first witness pretty much prove he's the culprit.

Now, looking at the evidence, I need to find something that contradicts these testimonies. Let's go through the evidence list:

- Evidence 0: Attorney's Badge - Not relevant here.
- Evidence 1: Seal - Found near the body, design unknown.
- Evidence 2: Crime Scene Notes - Details about the body's location and condition.
- Evidence 3: Mr. Tangaroa's Teapot - Paul Halique piece with fingerprints.
- Evidence 4: Contest Rules - Rules for the contest.
- Evidence 5: Frame Finger Marks - Finger marks without prints.
- Evidence 6: Mansion Key - Key that unlocks all doors, with Tangaroa.
- Evidence 7: Salt Lamp - Found in Scone's room, stained with victim's blood.
- Evidence 8: Fake Confections - Scone's fake creations.
- Evidence 9: Chocolates - Bound's handmade chocolates.
- Evidence 10: Instant Camera - Camera with few exposures left.
- Evidence 11: Mr. Frost's Room - Photos of Frost's sculptures.
- Evidence 12: Ms. Scone's Statement - Scone's statement about Frost's sculptures.
- Evidence 13: Semifinal Entries - Frost's and Gusto's creations.
- Evidence 14: Ultimate Cookbook - Formulas for cures and chemicals.
- Evidence 15: Victim's Blood - Blood found in the fountain.
- Evidence 16: Family Photo - Photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons.
- Evidence 17: Prosecutor's Badge - Not relevant here.
- Evidence 18: IS-7 Incident Case File - Overview of the IS-7 Incident.
- Evidence 19: Gallery Pamphlet - Pamphlet from the gallery.
- Evidence 20: Winter Wing Photo - Statues matching Frost's work.
- Evidence 21: Pisces Statue Sketch - Sketch by Larry.
- Evidence 22: Used Blowtorch - Signs of recent use.
- Evidence 23: Luminous Cloth - Glowing cloth, Scone's property.
- Evidence 24: Poison Gas Ingredients - Gas from mixing Ubiquium and Asphyxion.
- Evidence 25: Ultimate Cookbook - Same as Evidence 14.
- Evidence 26: Frame Finger Marks - Same as Evidence 5.
- Evidence 27: Salt Lamp - Same as Evidence 7.
- Evidence 28: Family Photo - Same as Evidence 16.
- Evidence 29: Teapot - Same as Evidence 3.
- Evidence 30: Ceramic Fragment - Found in tea, familiar design.
- Evidence 31: Lift Cart - Used by Frost, top wet.
- Evidence 32: Larry's Sketches - Sketches of what Larry saw.
- Evidence 33: Gemini Case Analysis Results - Analysis of melted contents.
- Evidence 34: Chocolates - Same as Evidence 9.
- Evidence 35: Statute of Limitations - Book on statutes.

Looking for contradictions, Testimony 1 mentions Normallium causing poison gas. However, Evidence 24 states that the gas was produced by mixing Ubiquium and Asphyxion, not Normallium. This directly contradicts Debeste's testimony about the cause of the poison gas. Therefore, Evidence 24 and Testimony 1 contradict each other.
</think>
